intro: Santiria caudata, commonly known as wild senna, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous pods and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with three to five leaflets and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruit is a slender, twisted pod that contains several seeds. Santiria caudata is often found in moist, open habitats such as swamps and wetlands.
